title: [Large-scale] Mixed-Methods-Based Microlearning to Improve English Teachers' Awareness of Teaching and Learning Styles

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English teaching experience and understanding of learning style concepts
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive mobile-based course for elementary English teachers within corporate settings

learning_goals: Teachers can distinguish Peacock’s cognitive teaching style types (group/individual, visual/auditory/tactile) and apply them contextually.
Based on Reid’s learning style theory, learners can propose at least three personalized instructional strategies.
Learners can apply Doyle & Rutherford’s matching instructional design principles to develop improvement plans for real-world lesson scenarios.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
